page.title: 10AYLESTONE SCHOOL - HEREFORD
page.content: This comprehensive school has 1150 pupils, in the age range 11-16. It was formed in 1976 with the amalgamation of the former Boys' and Girls' Grammar Schools. Modern buildings were completed in 1982 to house the school on one site. The school is set in spacious grounds on the Aylestone Campus. It has its own open air swimming pool and games fields. Pupils' uniform is grey with a black blazer for the boys and a gold checked blouse for the girls. The school has placed special emphasis on extra curricular activities. School buses provide transport for those pupils living more than 3 miles away; many come from villages such as Withington, Marden, Shellwick, Sutton, and Munstone.
